snippet: Bus operators called the strike an illegal walkout, but the National Labor Relations Board disagreed.
abstract: New York City's two-week-old school bus strike will continue after officials of the National Labor Relations Board refuse to order its end, rejecting complaint brought by coalition of 20 private bus companies arguing that strike is illegal.
lead_paragraph: Bus operators called the strike an illegal walkout, but the National Labor Relations Board disagreed.

headline.seo: N.L.R.B Refuses to Order Striking School Bus Drivers Back to Work
headline.main: Labor Board Refuses to Halt Strike by School Bus Drivers
headline.print_headline: Labor Board Refuses to Halt Strike by School Bus Drivers

keywords.value: New York City School Bus Contractors Coalition
keywords.name: organizations
